title: 112_hr1502
content: The "Team B Act" establishes the Counterterrorism Competitive Analysis Council to address evolving terrorism threats and enhance understanding through competitive analysis by experts outside the government. The Counterterrorism Competitive Analysis Council is established to advise on terrorism threats, prepare competitive analysis of intelligence estimates, and submit annual reports to Congress on counterterrorism trends and domestic radicalization. The Counterterrorism Competitive Analysis Council, composed of eight members appointed by the Director of National Intelligence, advises on terrorism threats and domestic radicalization. Members are selected based on experience with policy related to international terrorism. The Director of National Intelligence cannot appoint individuals who have recently served in the Federal Government to the Council. The Counterterrorism Competitive Analysis Council consists of eight members appointed by the Director of National Intelligence. Members must have experience with policy related to international terrorism. Each member serves a five-year term, with a maximum of two terms. Vacancies are filled for the remainder of the term, and every two years, a chair and vice chair are selected from among the members. The Counterterrorism Competitive Analysis Council appoints members with experience in international terrorism policy. Each member serves a five-year term, with a maximum of two terms. Members are paid at a rate not exceeding the annual rate of basic pay for level V of the Executive Schedule. The Council may appoint a Director and additional staff as needed, who are exempt from certain provisions of the United States Code regarding appointments and pay. The Counterterrorism Competitive Analysis Council appoints members with experience in international terrorism policy for five-year terms. The Council may procure expert services at specified rates and has access to national intelligence estimates on al-Qaeda and other terrorist organizations. The Counterterrorism Competitive Analysis Council can request intelligence information from the Director of National Intelligence and ensure cooperation from relevant agencies in providing security clearances. The Council is exempt from the Federal Advisory Committee Act, and there is an authorization of $5,000,000 for fiscal years 2012 through 2017. The Counterterrorism Competitive Analysis Council can request intelligence information and ensure agency cooperation for security clearances. An authorization of $5,000,000 is allocated for fiscal years 2012 through 2017, with a requirement to reduce the Office of the Director of National Intelligence's appropriation by the same amount. The initial report must be submitted within one year of the enactment of the Act, and a clerical amendment is made to the National Security Act of 1947.
